GenAIRR.mutation package

Submodules

GenAIRR.mutation.config module

class GenAIRR.mutation.config.MutationConfig(mutation_rate, model=MutationModels.UNIFORM)[source]

Bases: object

Configuration for mutation simulations or analyses.

This class encapsulates the configuration parameters for mutations, including the mutation rate and the model used to simulate mutations.

mutation_rate

The rate at which mutations occur. This value is model-dependent and can represent different concepts depending on the model, such as the probability of mutation per site per .

Type:

float

model

The mutation model to be used. Defaults to MutationModels.UNIFORM, indicating a uniform mutation rate across all sites.

Type:

MutationModels

Parameters:

  • mutation_rate (float) -- The rate of mutations. This could be, for example, the probability of mutation per site per generation.

  • model (MutationModels, optional) -- The model of mutation to apply. Defaults to MutationModels.UNIFORM.

class GenAIRR.mutation.config.MutationModels(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for specifying mutation models.

This enumeration defines the types of mutation models that can be used in simulations or analyses.

UNIFORM

Represents a uniform mutation model where mutations are assumed to occur at a constant rate across all sites.

S5F

Represents a specific, more complex 5-mer based mutation model.

S5F = 2
UNIFORM = 1

GenAIRR.mutation.mutation_model module

class GenAIRR.mutation.mutation_model.MutationModel[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for mutation models.

This class serves as a template for defining various mutation models. Subclasses are expected to implement the apply_mutation method, which applies the mutation logic to a given sequence.

apply_mutation(sequence)[source]

Abstract method to apply mutation to a sequence. Must be implemented by subclasses.

abstract apply_mutation(sequence)[source]

Applies mutation to a given sequence according to the model.

This is an abstract method and must be implemented by subclasses to define the specific mutation behavior.

Parameters:

sequence (sequence_object) -- The original sequence (DNA) to which mutations will be applied.

Returns:

The mutated sequence after applying the mutation model.

Return type:

str

Raises:

NotImplementedError -- If the subclass does not implement this method.

GenAIRR.mutation.s5f module

class GenAIRR.mutation.s5f.FiveMER(nucleotides)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a 5-mer, a sequence of 5 nucleotides, in a DNA sequence.

nucleotides

A list of Nucleotide objects that make up the 5-mer.

Type:

list

sequence

The nucleotide sequence of the 5-mer.

Type:

str

position

The position of the 5-mer within a larger sequence.

Type:

int

likelihood

The likelihood or probability of this 5-mer being mutated.

Type:

float

modified

Indicates whether the 5-mer has been modified.

Type:

bool

Parameters:

nucleotides (list) -- A list of Nucleotide objects.

change_center(new_value, mutability=None)[source]

Changes the central nucleotide of the 5-mer and updates sequences and likelihoods.

Parameters:

  • new_value (str) -- The new value for the central nucleotide.

  • mutability (dict, optional) -- A dictionary mapping 5-mer sequences to their mutability likelihoods.

static create_five_mers(dna_sequence, mutability=None)[source]

Creates a list of FiveMER objects from a DNA sequence.

Parameters:

  • dna_sequence (str) -- The DNA sequence from which to create 5-mers.

  • mutability (dict, optional) -- A dictionary mapping 5-mer sequences to their mutability likelihoods.

Returns:

A list of FiveMER objects.

Return type:

list

static five_mers_to_dna(five_mers)[source]

Converts a list of FiveMER objects back into a DNA sequence string.

Parameters:

five_mers (list) -- A list of FiveMER objects.

Returns:

The DNA sequence reconstructed from the FiveMER objects.

update_sequence(mutability=None)[source]

Updates the 5-mer sequence and optionally its mutability likelihood.

Parameters:

mutability (dict, optional) -- A dictionary mapping 5-mer sequences to their mutability likelihoods.

update_value(new_value, update_callback=None)[source]

Updates the nucleotide's value and optionally triggers a callback for each adjacent FiveMER.

Parameters:

  • new_value (str) -- The new nucleotide value.

  • update_callback (function, optional) -- A callback function to be called for each adjacent FiveMER.

class GenAIRR.mutation.s5f.S5F(min_mutation_rate=0, max_mutation_rate=0, custom_model=None)[source]

Bases: MutationModel

Implements the S5F mutation model, a specific model for simulating mutations in DNA sequences.

This class extends MutationModel and provides an implementation for applying mutations based on the S5F model.

min_mutation_rate

The minimum mutation rate.

Type:

float

max_mutation_rate

The maximum mutation rate.

Type:

float

targeting

A dictionary mapping targeting information.

Type:

dict

substitution

A dictionary mapping substitution probabilities.

Type:

dict

mutability

A dictionary mapping mutability scores.

Type:

dict

bases

A set of valid nucleotide bases.

Type:

set

loaded_metadata

Indicates whether the mutation metadata has been loaded.

Type:

bool

custom_model

Path to a custom mutation model file.

Type:

str, optional

Parameters:

  • min_mutation_rate (float) -- The minimum mutation rate.

  • max_mutation_rate (float) -- The maximum mutation rate.

  • custom_model (str, optional) -- Path to a custom mutation model file.

apply_mutation(sequence_object)[source]

Applies mutations to a given sequence object based on the S5F mutation model.

Parameters:

sequence_object (Sequence) -- The sequence object to which mutations will be applied.

Returns:

A tuple containing the mutated sequence, a dictionary of mutations, and the mutation rate.

Return type:

tuple

load_metadata(sequence)[source]

Loads mutation model metadata based on the sequence type.

Parameters:

sequence (Sequence) -- The sequence object, used to determine the appropriate metadata to load.

Raises:

ValueError -- If the sequence type is unsupported.

static weighted_choice(five_mers)[source]

Selects a FiveMER object from a list, weighted by their likelihoods.

Parameters:

five_mers (list) -- A list of FiveMER objects.

Returns:

A randomly selected FiveMER object, weighted by likelihood.

Return type:

FiveMER

GenAIRR.mutation.uniform module

class GenAIRR.mutation.uniform.Uniform(min_mutation_rate=0, max_mutation_rate=0)[source]

Bases: MutationModel

Implements a uniform mutation model as a subclass of MutationModel.

This mutation model applies mutations across the sequence at a uniform rate, ignoring non-polymorphic (NP) regions.

min_mutation_rate

The minimum mutation rate to be considered when applying mutations.

Type:

float

max_mutation_rate

The maximum mutation rate to be considered when applying mutations.

Type:

float

bases

A set containing the nucleotide bases ('A', 'T', 'C', 'G') used in mutations.

Type:

set

Parameters:

  • min_mutation_rate (float) -- The minimum mutation rate, defaulting to 0.

  • max_mutation_rate (float) -- The maximum mutation rate, defaulting to 0.

apply_mutation(sequence_object)[source]

Applies mutations to the given sequence object based on the uniform mutation model.

The method randomly selects positions to mutate based on the calculated mutation rate and mutates them to a different base.

Parameters:

sequence_object (Sequence) -- The sequence object to which mutations will be applied. It must have an 'ungapped_seq' attribute.

Returns:

A tuple containing the mutated sequence, a dictionary of mutations with positions as keys and mutations as values, and the mutation rate.

Return type:

tuple

mutable_positions(sequence)[source]

Identifies mutable positions in the sequence, excluding (NP) regions.

Parameters:

sequence (Sequence) -- The sequence object containing V, D, and J region start and end positions.

Returns:

A list of positions that are eligible for mutation, combining positions from V, D, and J regions.

Return type:

list
